selected_quotes: If a doctor is wined and dined by pharma reps, are they more likely to prescribe their drug? The research says yes. ht…
De cómo las industrias farmacéuticas invitan e influyen en los médicos, que creen que A mí no me influye ¡Q error!
Most of us like to think we aren't influenced by drug ads freebies. But we are
Noooo, si a mi no me afecta, es a los demás!! Actividades d promoción d la industria farma. Vía
Lots of wine, lots of dine: $43m in 6 months. I guess pharma expects drs to return the favour?

citation.abstract: The view of many doctors that “I don’t let myself be influenced” might be the biggest barrier to change.

news.title: Invisible influence: why sales reps are forming relationships with nurses
news.summary: Last week Fairfax Media revealed pharmaceutical companies are spending lavish amounts treating Australian doctors to lunches, dinners and overseas trips.

news.title: We can't trust drug companies to wine, dine and educate doctors about the drugs they prescribe
news.summary: If a drug company treats a doctor to a nice lunch and a presentation on their newest products, is prescribing affected? Doctors generally think not, but the research evidence overwhelmingly says yes.

news.title: Drug companies are buying doctors – for as little as a $16 meal
news.summary: An important new study in the United States has found doctors who receive just one cheap meal from a drug company tend to prescribe a lot more of that company’s products.
